newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican coffee crop unharmed by Andres -growers.
newsitem.headline: Mexican coffee crop unharmed by Andres -growers.

text.p: Mexico's coffee crops in southern Chiapas state received a lot of rain, but were unharmed by the recent proximity of Tropical Storm Andres, coffee growers said on Wednesday.
"There were just showers, but no damage to coffee zones," Chiapas coffee grower Roberto Giesemann told Reuters.

"There was rain but it wasn't very strong and did not affect the crops," added coffee grower Alfredo Moises Ceja. Andres swept by the Chiappas coast in recent days and local weather reports said it was expected to land in Guatemala or El Salvador later in the day on Thursday.

In the early afternoon, the first storm front of the season was located about 135 miles (216 km) south-southeast of Tapachula, Chiapas state, a key coffee growing region. Mexico's National Weather Service said Andres was moving southeast at 11 miles (18 km) per hour.
Andres was generating winds of 65 to 75 km (40 to 45 miles) and waves up to 12 feet high, it said.
